description:
You can edit the team you wish to take with you on Quests
in the {color: #FFFF00}Team{color} menu.
 
You can choose {color: #FFFF00}up to 6 characters{color} per team.

Characters that have an identical name and 
second name cannot be included on the same 
team (certain characters excluded).

Perform “Training” to obtain Character EXP. 
Strength up your characters by obtaining EXP and leveling up.

The instructions for {color : #FFFF00 }“Training”{color} are as follows:

Step 1: Select a Training Character to Train 
Step 2: Select a Training Location 
Step 3: Select Training Partners and Training Items 
(choose either one or both)

Required Zeni for "Training"
When you choose to train with Training Partners, 
the required amount of Zeni will vary 
according to the level of Training Character.
When you choose to train with Training Items, 
the required amount of Zeni will vary depending 
on the kinds of Training Items, regardless of 
the level of Training Character.


{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}Undergo Training with only
Training Items!{outline}{color}{size}

You can increase a character's stats through {color: #FFFF00}Awakening{color}. 

There are five types of Awakening: 
1. Awakening 
2. Z-Awakening 
3. Dokkan Awakening 
4. Extreme Z-Awakening 
5. Super Extreme Z-Awakening 

* Numbers 3, 4 and 5 are only available 
to certain characters.

The following explanation applies to number 1 
(Awakening) only. 

Awakening requires Awakening Medals and Zeni, 
and the required quantity varies by character.

Touch the icon of the Awakening Medals that you wish to use,
and then touch the "Awakening" icon to awaken the character.

A character doesn't get any EXP from "Awakening."
However, you can perform an Awakening regardless of the
character's level.
Once you have collected the required Medals,
You can perform an Awakening right away!

By {color: #FFFF00}Z-Awakening{color} your characters, 
you can greatly increase their stats.

Also, the character's Rarity will be upped, their Type will be 
enhanced and their max level will be increased.

Z-Awakening can take place only when:
1: The character's level is at maximum
2: All the required Awakening Medals have been obtained
3: The required amount of Zeni has been obtained

The character's Super Attack level will be 
carried over after Z-Awakening.

By {color: #FFFF00}Dokkan Awakening{color},  you can push the potential of 
a character to a whole new level!

Dokkan Awakening requires the following: 
1. A max level Z-Awakened character. 
2. All necessary Awakening Medals. 
3. The necessary amount of Zeni. 

A Dokkan Awakened character will be treated as a new 
character, which means the character's level will revert to 1. 
(The character's Super Attack level will be carried over.) 

After Dokkan Awakening, characters can be 
leveled up or Z-Awakened once more 
for even greater power! 

Please note that Dokkan Awakened characters generally 
cannot be reverted to their pre-awakened state. 

Only transcended UR (Max Lv. 120) and LR characters 
can use Reverse to revert to their pre-Dokkan Awakened state. 

* Not all characters can be Dokkan Awakened. 
In addition, some characters cannot be Z-Awakened 
after Dokkan Awakening.

*If after Dokkan Awakening the character's name changes, 
their Super Attack level will not increase when using them as 
Training Partners.

{color: #FFFF00}Leader skills{color} are unique abilities which are activated by placing 
The character in the Leader slot.

When a Leader belonging to a Friend accompanies you on a 
quest, that character's Leader Skill will be activated as well.

The effects of Leader Skills will be active even if the Leader
is not participating in the attack.

*There are some events which have a condition where 
  "The Leader Skill of the selected Friend will not be activated".

{color: #FFFF00}Passive Skills{color} are special abilities that activate 
in battle under certain conditions. 

A Passive Skill is activated during the attacking turn of 
the character to whom it belongs. Activation conditions 
and the timing of effects differ from skill to skill. 

You can check a Passive Skill's effects and 
activation conditions in the "Passive Skill" 
section on the "Character Details" page. 

* A Passive Skill will have no effect on enemies who 
can nullify its effects, even if the activation conditions 
have been met (including effects that are guaranteed 
to be triggered). 
* In the case of skills that specify a particular 
character name, it is possible that future characters 
are also excluded from the list of applicable characters 
even if that is not specified in the skill description.

Each character possesses a number of {color: #FFFF00}Link Skills{color}. 

When choosing the attack order during battle, if characters with 
the same Link Skills are placed next to each other and the 
requirement for each Link Skill is satisfied, these skills will 
automatically activate. 

But if the characters who are placed next to each other have 
the same name, their Link Skills will not activate.

You can review the skill details under the "Link Skills" section of 
"Character Details."

Furthermore, tapping on a Link Skill opens up 
a list that shows the characters who possess 
that particular Link Skill.

By adding a character to {color: #FFFF00}"Favorite"{color}, you can prevent the 
character from being used as a Training Partner, sold or 
exchanged for Trade Points at Baba's Shop. 

Tap the {color: #FFFF00}lock icon{color} on the top right corner of the character 
details page to favorite or un-favorite a character.

Characters you have favorited will be marked 
with a lock icon in your character list. 

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}= Special Characters ={outline}{color}{size} 
There are characters who cannot be removed from 
"Favorite" unless certain conditions are met. 

The condition(s) can be checked by tapping the lock icon.

The objective is to advance towards the goal while defeating 
opponents you encounter along the way.

To advance forward, tap on one of the "Randomized number 
buttons" at the bottom of the screen and you will move the 
chosen amount of spaces.

*The numbers on the "Randomized number buttons" are 
decided randomly.

When the path forks, you must choose 
which direction you wish to go.

Be careful of what lies ahead as you move forward.

In high-difficulty stages, the enemies will become stronger 
but the rewards obtained, such as EXP and Zeni, will increase.

There are a variety of different tiles on the map. 

Generally, {color: #FF0000}red{color} tiles indicate danger, 
{color: #0000FF}blue{color} tiles indicate a reward and 
{color: #FFFF00}yellow{color} tiles indicate a random occurrence. 

The details of each tile are as follows:
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Battle" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, you will 
enter a battle with an enemy.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"STOP" Tile{color}

You are forced to stop at the STOP tile,
and you will enter a battle with an enemy.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Attack" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, you will get attacked 
by an enemy and receive damage.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Zeni" Tile{color}
If you stop on this tile, you can obtain Zeni.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Hoi-Poi Capsule{color} {color: #0000FF}(Blue){color}{color: #FFFF00}" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can obtain a Support Item.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Hoi-Poi Capsule{color} {color: #FF0000}(Red){color}{color: #FFFF00}" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can obtain a Training Item.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Hoi-Poi Capsule{color} {color: #CC66FF}(Purple){color}{color: #FFFF00}" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can obtain an Awakening Medal.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Hoi-Poi Capsule{color} {color: #4DB56A}(Green){color}{color: #FFFF00}" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can obtain a Memory Medal.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Ki Boost" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile,
1 of your team member's Ki will be boosted.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Baba" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can exchange Zeni for items.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Dragon Ball" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile,
you can obtain a Dragon Ball.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Treasure" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile,
you can obtain "Treasure".
You can exchange Treasures for
characters or items at Baba's Shop.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Potential Orb" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, 
you can obtain a Potential Orb or Skill Orb. 

Potential Orbs can be used to activate a character's 
Hidden Potential, while Skill Orbs can be used to 
boost a character's stats or raise a character's 
Hidden Potential Skill level.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Link Skill Orb" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, you can obtain a Link Skill Orb. 
Link Skill Orbs can be used to level up Link Skills.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"?" Tile{color}

This tile indicates a random occurrence. 
With the exception of some "?" tiles, if you stop 
on this tile, one of the situations below occurs: 

　- Obtain Zeni 
　- Obtain an item 
　- Boost Ki 
　- Receive damage
You must spend {color: #FFFF00}Stamina{color} to go on a Quest.

The required Stamina for each stage differs 
according to the difficulty level. 

1 Stamina (STA) is recovered every 5 minutes. 
You can also use STA-Restoring Items or 
1 Dragon Stone to restore your STA. 

Please navigate the following path for more information 
on STA-Restoring Items: "Help" > "How to Play" 
> "Items" > "STA-Restoring Items". 

When restoring STA with a Dragon Stone, 
the amount of STA restored is as below: 
- If your Maximum STA is 50 or more, 
your STA will be restored by the value 
equivalent to your Maximum STA. 
- If your Maximum STA is below 50, 
your STA will be restored by 50.

If you restore your STA by using a Dragon Stone, 
any restored STA that exceeds the value of 
your Maximum STA will still be retained. 
For example, if the maximum value of your STA is 100 
and your remaining STA is 50, the 100 STA restored will 
be added to your remaining 50 STA, which makes your 
overall STA become 150 temporarily. 

However, when selecting a stage to challenge, 
your original Maximum STA needs to exceed 
the STA required to challenge the stage. 

* When your Rank is raised, your STA will be fully restored. 
* If your Rank is raised more than 1 level in one go, your 
STA after your Rank is raised will be the remaining STA + 
the STA restored for each level raised.

{color: #FFFF00}Dragon Balls{color} can be found in certain stages. 

To check the stages where Dragon Balls can be found, 
go to "Team" --> "Shenron" then tap on the 
Dragon Balls you haven't retrieved yet. 

When retrieving a Dragon Ball, you must land 
on the exact tile it's on to retrieve it, so plan 
carefully as you advance through the map.
When you retrieve all 7 Dragon Balls you can {color: #FFFF00}make a wish{color}.

Check the list to see what wishes you can make.

Please note that once you have collected every Dragon Ball 
available at the moment, the Dragon Radar will not respond.

*The whereabouts of the Dragon Balls will not change unless 
you use up a wish.

If you select "Abandon Quest" during a battle, you will resign 
not only from the battle, but from the Quest as well.

By choosing to give up, you will lose all items obtained, except 
for the character Exp Points gained in battle.

During battle, your {color: #FFFF00}Ki Meter{color} will rise according to the number of 
{color: #FFFF00}Ki Spheres{color} you've obtained, 
thus determining your attack strength.

When you obtain Ki Spheres that are the same color as your 
Type, your Ki Meter will increase at {color: #FFFF00}double the usual rate{color} 
and you will regain a small amount of HP.

*The Ki in your Ki Meter is only valid for one turn, so you must 
obtain new Ki every turn.

*Your Ki Meter may already contain Ki due to your character's 
skill or the effect of a previously landed-on Tile.

In addition, if the character is  "Z-Awakened," then 
{color: #FFFF00}"Super"{color} or {color: #FFFF00}"Extreme"{color} is added to their Type.
With either of these powered up Types, your damage against 
a weaker Type is increased, along with your endurance against 
a stronger Type.

*When a battle takes place between two "Super" Types, or two 
"Extreme" Types, the above chart still applies.

*When a "Super" Type attacks an "Extreme" Type, or an 
"Extreme" Type attacks a "Super" Type, in both situations attack 
damage increases.

You can switch which opponent you wish to attack by 
tapping the opponent's icon on the top of your 
battle screen.

The number on top of the enemy's icon 
indicates the number of turns left until the enemy's attack. 
The enemy will attack on the turn that this number reaches 0.

Fight strategically by taking the characters' Types and attack 
order into consideration.

You can also tap the enemy icons at the bottom of the battle 
screen to change the target you wish to attack.

Your characters' attack order is displayed in the lower portion of 
the battle screen. The order begins {color: #FFFF00}on the left{color} and continues 
on to the right.

You can change the attack order of those characters whose 
Ki Sphere path has not yet been chosen.

Be aware of the placing of the enemies' attack icons and 
strategize against this by placing characters with higher 
defense against them.

When your character's Ki Meter reaches a certain level, that 
character's {color: #FFFF00}Super Attack{color} will be activated.

The required amount of Ki can be checked on each character's 
Character Details screen.

For example, this character needs {color: #FFFF00}4{color} Ki Spheres to attack at 100% 
power, and {color: #FFFF00}12{color} Ki Spheres to launch their Super Attack, 
according to the image above.

When the {color: #FFFF00}Dokkan Gauge{color} below your HP bar is full and your 
character's Super Attack is activated, you will enter 
{color: #FFFF00}Dokkan Mode{color}.

Dokkan Mode will strengthen your Super Attack and allow it to 
damage all your opponents.

The Dokkan Gauge increases as you obtain Ki Spheres.
When you obtain Ki spheres that are the same color as your Type, 
the Dokkan Gauge will increase {color: #FFFF00}twice as much as usual{color}.

*The Dokkan Gauge will reset once you leave a stage.
You can bring {color: #FFFF00}Support Items{color} with you on your Quest.

Items have a variety of effects such as recovering your HP or 
strengthening your attack. Try and choose the best items 
for each stage.
(However, the effects of all but a set number of items will not be 
repeated if you use the same item in the same turn.)

You can increase the number of item slots you possess by using 
wishes granted by the Dragon Balls.

In addition, please note that there is a limit to how many of each 
item you can bring on a Quest, and there are some items 
which cannot be used on the Map.
Gain more Exp Points by using {color: #FFFF00}Training Items{color} when Training.

You can get Training Items through various ways, 
such as Quests, login bonuses and Baba's Shop.

{color: #FFFF00}Awakening Medals{color} are items that are required to Awaken 
your characters.

The type and quantity of items required for Awakening are 
different for each character.

You can get Awakening Medals from Quests, Login Bonuses, 
Baba's Shop, etc..

Selecting a player who is your {color: #FFFF00}Friend{color} when 
attempting Quests will earn you more Friend Points. 

Raising your Rank may increase the 
maximum number of Friends you can have. 

More Friends means a bigger advantage 
when tackling Quests! 

Please note that you will not be able to send 
a friend request in the following situations: 
- Your number of Friends has reached the limit. 
- The other player's number of Friends has reached the limit.
If you have {color: #FFFF00}Friend Points{color} you can try {color: #FFFF00}Friend Summon{color}.

Tap the "Character List" at the bottom of the 
Summon page to check the complete list of 
available characters in the Summon. 

You can obtain 100 Friend Points by going on a Quest 
with a player who is your Friend, and 50 Friend Points 
by going on a Quest with other players. 

Each player can only earn points for you once per day. 
Your points will not increase if you select 
the same player more than once. 

* Selecting a Special Friend will not earn you 
any Friend Points.

You may transfer game data to another device by:
1. Using a third-party account
2. Using a Transfer Code

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}1. Third-Party Account Linking{outline}{color}{size} 

1. Navigate to "Data Linking & Back Up" from "Menu" or 
tap "Account Linking" on the lower half of the title screen, 
then select a third-party service and log in to the 
third-party account to complete data linking.

2. When launching the game for the first time,
select "Continue Game" and log in to the linked
third-party account to complete data transfer.

{color : #FFFF00}* Any incomplete purchases will be canceled.{color} 
{color : #FFFF00}* Dragon Stones cannot be transferred 
between different operating systems.{color} 
{color : #FFFF00}* Please note that your "Daily Capsule" subscription 
cannot be transferred between different operating systems.{color} 
{color : #FFFF00}* Please proceed with "Google Account Linking" or 
"Facebook Account Linking" if you would like to transfer 
your data to a device of a different operating system.{color} 
* Please note that if the linked third-party account is deleted, 
you will not be able to transfer game data using the account. 
* If you have transferred data using a third-party account, 
any pre-existing Transfer Code will become invalid. 
* Please only attempt data linking and transfer in a place 
with a stable network connection. The data may 
become corrupted if the network connection is unstable. 
* You may link your game data to multiple 
third-party accounts at the same time. 
* A third-party account can only save the game data 
from one game account. 
{color : #FFFF00}* "Sign in with Apple" will only be displayed on 
devices that run iOS 13 or later.{color}

If you restart the app during a Quest, your game 
will continue from where you left off. 

* If the autosave data is deleted, the items obtained 
during the Quest will be lost. In addition, the STA and 
items consumed in the Quest will be lost as well.
You can claim various rewards by completing {color: #FFFF00}missions{color}.

If an exclamation mark "!" shows on the Mission icon on the 
Home page, it indicates that you have rewards unclaimed.

The amount of unclaimed rewards can be identified on the 
Mission page.

In addition, a {color: #FFFF00}"NEW"{color} icon will appear if there are mission 
"Details" you haven't checked on.

The rewards can be claimed directly. You do not 
have to claim them from the Gift Box. 

Mission progress can be checked from "Progress", 
which is located at the "Mission" page. 
(If it is a mission that requires you to fulfill the 
condition in a single attempt, the progress bar 
will show the best record instead.) 

You can claim the rewards of a completed mission at any time. 
However, please note you have to claim the Daily Mission 
rewards before the daily update of the missions.

·The items you can attain by using Trade Points change over time. 
You can use Dragon Stones to update the items immediately. 

·The selection of available items is chosen randomly. 

·Initially, only a few item slots are available. 
You can use Trade Points to unlock more item slots. 

·Sometimes rare items or discounts can be found. 

{color : #FF0000}*The Zeni and Trade Points required for items may fluctuate 
without prior notice.{color}
You can exchange characters and items for {color : #FFFF00}Trade Points{color}.

·The amount of Trade Points you get from the exchange depends 
on the character or item you offer. {color : #FF0000}Please note that characters 
and items cannot be retrieved once exchanged.{color} 


·There are also certain items that Baba will not accept.

There are also items that can be purchased with {color : #FFFF00}Zeni{color} at 
Baba's Shop.

·For certain items that can be purchased with Zeni, 
they will be restocked after a certain period of time 
when the purchase limit is reached. 

·The list of items that can be purchased with Zeni 
rarely changes.

There are also items that can be purchased with {color : #FFFF00}Treasures{color} at 
Baba's Shop.

·The required type and quantity of Treasures differ 
depending on the item. 
 
·Treasures can be obtained on the maps in "Quest" 
starting from Area 16 "Reunited" or through other 
means, such as from certain events.

·Some items have fixed periods of availability.

·New Treasure types will be available from time to time.

· Baba's Shop is a place where you can exchange 
unwanted items for Trade Points and purchase 
items you want with those points. 

· If you have collected more Awakening Medals or items than 
you need, exchange them for Trade Points at Baba's Shop. 

· You can also try your luck at Baba's Shop if you 
miss the chance to collect certain Awakening Medals 
in events, as they might appear there for trade. 
Keep an eye on the update timer for new stock!

During battle, a character's stats may change and 
the character may suffer abnormal effects due to 
characters' or enemies' skills. In addition, certain 
enemy skills can nullify specific attacks or actions. 
 
These stat and status changes will be indicated by 
icons shown on the character's icon. You can check 
the skills that the enemy has activated by tapping 
and holding the enemy's character icon. 
 
Please refer to the following for what each icon 
represents.
{color : #FFFF00}▼ATK Up{color}
Character's ATK increases.
{color : #FFFF00}▼DEF Up{color}
Character's DEF increases.
{color : #FFFF00}▼Ki Up{color}
Character's Ki increases.
{color : #FFFF00}Chance of Performing a Critical Hit Raised{color}

Character's chance of performing a critical hit 
is increased.
{color : #FFFF00}Damage Reduction Rate Raised{color}
Character's damage reduction rate is increased.
{color : #FFFF00}▼ATK Down{color}
Character's ATK decreases.
{color : #FFFF00}▼DEF Down{color}
Character's DEF decreases.
{color : #FFFF00}Chance of Performing a Critical Hit Lowered{color}

Character's chance of performing a critical hit 
is lowered.
{color : #FFFF00}Damage Reduction Rate Lowered{color}
Character's damage reduction rate is lowered.
{color : #FFFF00}▼Stunned{color}
The character is unable to attack when stunned

Certain characters can turn into "Giant Form" 
(Giant Form, Giant Ape, Rage, etc.) with their Passive Skills.

Turning into "Giant Form" will trigger the following effects: 
- The character will become your only active character.
- The character will perform all attacks.
- The character will receive a massive ATK boost 
and will become immune to damage and status effects.

HP, ATK and DEF raised through Hidden Potential activation 
as well as Potential Skills such as "Combo Attack" and 
"Critical Hit" are still valid during Giant Form Transformation.

There is a set probability that the transformation may end
at the end of each turn if the duration of the transformation 
is not specified.

In addition to "Giant Form", "Giant Ape" and "Rage", 
Giant Form Transformation also includes "Core appears", 
"break Phantom Majin's Seal", etc.

* The requirement(s), probability and maximum number of 
Giant Form Transformations differ between characters.
The count for the number of times a character can 
turn into Giant Form will reset when the battle ends.
* During Giant Form mode, Support Items cannot be used, and 
one's HP will not be recovered even after attaining Ki Spheres 
of the character's Type. Moreover, the Dokkan Gauge will be 
frozen, and Dokkan Mode will not be triggered even if the 
Dokkan Gauge is full when the Giant Form mode is activated.
* The effect of the character's skills, such as Passive Skill, 
may change during Giant Form Transformation.
* Turns passed during Giant Form state
will not be counted.

The basic battle rules are as follows.
You win when the HP of each enemy is reduced to 0, and 
you lose when the total HP of your allies drops to 0.
If the total HP of your allies drops to 0, you can continue 
the battle by using one Dragon Stone.

Right after using a Continue, the unperformed actions of 
both allies and enemies in the turn in which your team HP 
reaches 0 will be skipped. The battle will resume from the 
next turn, and you will receive the following effects: 

{color: #FFFF00}- HP of allies fully recovers 
- All allies' Ki +3 for 1 turn 
- Dokkan Gauge increases{color} 

{color: #FF0000}*If a character "transforms" due to an Active Skill or 
through other means in the turn right after using a Continue, 
the Ki +3 effect from the Continue will not come into effect.{color} 

*Continues cannot be used in certain stages.

Hidden Potential Activation is a feature that allows you 
to strengthen your characters further by accessing the 
power that exists beyond their max level. 
 
* This feature is unrelated to the "Hidden Potential" 
mentioned in Link Skills, character names, and so on. 
 
To use this feature, your Player Rank must be 
{color : #FFFF00}Rank 20 or higher{color}. 
 
Activating a character's Hidden Potential requires items 
called {color : #FF00FF}Potential Orbs{color}. Furthermore, only characters 
with a rarity of UR or LR can be developed further 
with Hidden Potential Activation. 
 
* Effects from a character's Hidden Potential will 
still be applied when the character transforms into 
special states such as Giant Ape and Rage.

Potential Orbs are required to activate a character's 
Hidden Potential. As a general rule, you will need 
an Orb of the same Type as the character's Type.

There are three orb sizes: small (S), medium (M), and large (L). 
As you progress in activating a character's Hidden Potential, 
the size of Potential Orbs required will change.

You can obtain Potential Orbs by various means, 
including earning rewards in the weekly event 
"Activate Your Hidden Potential".

The term "Hidden Potential Stats" refers to a character's 
HP, ATK and DEF that have been boosted by 
the Hidden Potential Activation feature.

The stats that will be boosted, and the types and 
number of Potential Orbs required will vary depending on 
the node being activated.

Hidden Potential Skills can be learned by activating 
a character's Hidden Potential.

There are seven kinds of Hidden Potential Skills in total, 
and their chances of being activated, 
as well as the strength of their effect, 
grow as you raise the skill's level.

{size : 26}1. Combo Attack{size}

Grants a rare chance of performing an {color : #FFFF00}extra attack{color}. 
The higher the skill level, 
the higher the chance of unleashing an extra attack.

{size : 26}2. Critical{size}

Grants a rare chance of performing a {color : #FFFF00}critical hit{color}. 
This attack boosts damage, ignores the enemy's DEF, 
and is effective against all Types. The higher the skill level, 
the higher the chance of performing a critical hit.

{size : 26}3. Evasion{size}

Grants a rare chance of {color : #FFFF00}evading an enemy's attack (including 
Super Attack){color}. 
However, this doesn't work against certain abilities, 
including Passive Skills. The higher the skill level, 
the higher the chance of evading successfully.

{size : 26}4. Type ATK Boost{size}

{color : #FFFF00}Slightly raises ATK{color} when AGL attacks STR, STR attacks PHY, 
PHY attacks INT, INT attacks TEQ, or TEQ attacks AGL, 
and it works for both Super or Extreme Types. 
The effect increases along with the skill level.

{size : 26}5. Type DEF Boost{size}

{color : #FFFF00}Slightly lowers damage received{color} when AGL is attacked by STR, 
STR is attacked by PHY, PHY is attacked by INT, 
INT is attacked by TEQ, and TEQ is attacked by AGL, 
and it works for both Super or Extreme Types. 
The effect increases along with the skill level.

{size : 24}6. Super Attack Boost{size}

{color : #FFFF00}Slightly raises the amount of HP recovered{color} when obtaining 
a Ki Sphere that matches that character's Type. 
The effect increases along with the skill level.

{color : #FFFF00}Some nodes give you the choice to activate 
one of several optional Hidden Potential Skills.{color} 
The items required to activate each skill are the same, 
but the number of levels raised may differ.

Once you've learned an optional skill, you can {color : #FFFF00}forget{color} it by 
tapping its node again. {color : #FFFF00}Any skill node you forget 
will revert to its original state{color}.

Note that you must use either Dragon Stones or 
an identical character to forget a skill.

{color : #FF0000}Relearning a skill you've forgotten also requires Potential Orbs, 
just like when you first learned it{color}.

The nodes with optional skills are marked with a star.

There are four categories by which you can strengthen a 
character, with each category branching in a different 
direction on the board.

{size : 26}1. Balance{size}
Extends to the upper-left.
{color : #FFFF00}Well-balanced development{color} of ATK, DEF and other stats, 
with optional Hidden Potential Skills 
at the end of the additional route.

{size : 26}2. Offense{size}
Extends to the upper-right.
{color : #FFFF00}Develop a character's ATK.{color} 

{size : 26}3. HP & Defense{size}

{size : 26}4. High Growth{size}
Extends to the lower-right.
{color : #FFFF00}Boosted development of both ATK and DEF{color}, 
with optional Hidden Potential Skills 
at the end of the additional route. 
However, you can only activate nodes on this route 
{color : #FFFF00}if the Super Attack is above a certain level{color}.

Lastly, strengthening a character by 
activating the Hidden Potential {color : #FFFF00}is different for each character{color}, 
so the above information may not always apply.

You may run into roadblocks while activating 
a character's Hidden Potential. 
To get past these obstacles and move on to further nodes, 
you must use an {color : #FF0000}identical character{color} to the one 
whose Hidden Potential that you are activating.

When you unlock an additional route, the block 
will change to a regular stat node that can be 
activated with Potential Orbs. 

{color : #FFFF00}An additional route can be unlocked even if 
the nodes leading up to it are not yet activated.{color} 

{color : #FFFF00}It doesn't matter whether the identical character 
you use to unlock a route has been Z-Awakened or not{color}, 
but {color : #FFFF00}the character's Dokkan Awakened form will be 
considered a different character{color}. Note that {color : #FFFF00}characters 
whose routes have all been unlocked cannot be used to 
unlock the route of another character{color}.

The four icons on the top-right of the screen indicate 
the locked/unlocked status of additional routes.

Tapping one of these icons will jump straight to the place 
where an additional route can be unlocked.

Reverse allows you to {color : #FFFF00}temporarily revert 
a transcended UR (Max Lv. 120) or LR character 
to their pre-Dokkan Awakened rarity{color}.

You can use this feature to unlock an additional 
Hidden Potential route for Dokkan Awakened characters 
or when you have troubles with strengthening 
a Dokkan Awakened character.

Reverse will change a character's stats and Super Attack level 
to those of their Reversed states, 
which means they may go down temporarily. 
However, the reversed characters can be restored to 
their previous status through the {color : #FFFF00}Reverse Dokkan Awakening{color}.

Reversing requires a special Awakening Medal called 
{color : #FF00FF}Incredible Hourglass{color}.

You can obtain Incredible Hourglasses at Baba's Shop, 
among other places.

A Reverse Dokkan Awakening will restore Reversed characters 
to their Dokkan Awakened status. 
Unlike a normal Dokkan Awakening, 
{color : #FFFF00}this doesn't require any Awakening Medals or Zeni{color}.

After a Reverse Dokkan Awakening, 
characters are restored to their status before the Reverse. 
However, {color : #FFFF00}as with Z-Awakening and Dokkan Awakening, 
any activated Hidden Potential and boosted Super Attack levels 
will be carried over.{color}

Displayed on enemies whose attacking turn

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}Auto Button for Training Items{outline}{color}{size} 
By tapping the Auto button, Training Items will be selected 
automatically based on the amount of EXP required to level up 
the character to the max level. Up to 50 Training Items of the 
same Type will be set automatically (10 for each kind of item, 
and up to 5 kinds). If you don't have enough Training Items for 
your selected character to reach the max level, items will be 
set automatically to get the character as close to max level as 
possible. Training Location effects are also taken into account.

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}Raising Super Attack Level{outline}{color}{size} 
Raising a character's Super Attack Level increases 
the Super Attack power. To raise Super Attack Level, 
select a Training Partner identical to the Training Character. 
There is a chance of leveling up the Super Attack if you 
select a Training Partner of the same character name 
but a different second name.

Z-Awaken the same-name character you want to use as 
a Training Partner to increase the chances of leveling up 
the Super Attack. The chance of a Super Attack level-up 
is displayed when selecting a Training Partner. The chances 
are counted separately for each Training Partner, and each 
Training Partner can only raise the Super Attack Level by 1, 
regardless of the Training Partner's Super Attack Level.

If you select an identical character as a Training Partner, 
the Training Partner's Super Attack Level will be added 
to the Training Character's Super Attack Level.

In addition, there is a chance of obtaining bonus EXP 
when the result of training is Big Success, 
Great Success or Super Success. 

* Please note that the Training Partners, Training Items 
and Training Locations (except for Wasteland) used 
in Training will be consumed. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Max Growth ={color}{outline}{size} 
By tapping the "Max Growth" button, the 
Training Location, Training Partners and 
Training Items will be automatically selected 
for the character to reach the max level.
{color: #FFFF00}Category{color} defines different groups to which characters belong.

Building your teams with characters in the same Category 
triggers Special Effects in certain stages or battles. 
The activated Special Effect will differ between Categories.
* Please note that some characters may not belong to any 
Categories.
* Please note that Categories are subject to be added or changed 
without prior notice.

Extreme Z-Awakening raises the limit of a character's 
max level and its Super Attack level, 
allowing a character to become even more powerful. 

The Awakening Medals required for 
Extreme Z-Awakening each character is different. 
You can get the required Awakening Medals 
in the corresponding Extreme Z-Battle. 

Check the Awakening screen after Extreme Z-Awakening 
to see how much a character has powered up! 

Note: Characters must be at their max level 
before they can be Extreme Z-Awakened.

Extreme Z-Battle is a super-difficult event where you'll
battle enemies that get stronger each time you defeat them.

No Continues or Support Items are 
allowed in Extreme Z-Battle, 
but no STA will be consumed 
unless you retry a level you have already cleared.

Each time you defeat an enemy in Extreme Z-Battle, 
the enemy will level up, 
making the battle tougher! 

Other than changes to the HP, ATK, DEF parameters, 
other special changes may also occur 
after an enemy levels up.

You can tell how powerful an enemy 
has become from his or her level-up animation and 
the information provided in the Battle Info dialog.

Boosts from the latest level increase will be shown in yellow. 

The Battle Info dialog also provides information 
on ally characters that are effective against the enemy.

Extreme Z-Battle has 
a checkpoint every few levels. 

After clearing a checkpoint level, 
you can rechallenge it by consuming STA. 

To rechallenge, select the enemy's level 
by tapping the "Select Lv" button.

The highest level you reach will not reset even if you
retry a level you have already cleared.
You can return to the highest level reached
at any time by tapping the "Select Lv" button.

There are two types of rewards 
that you can obtain from Extreme Z-Battles: 
1) Clear a level for the first time 
2) Reclear a checkpoint level.  

Rewards obtained upon reclearing a stage 
are determined randomly. 

In addition, you may get the Awakening Medals required 
for Extreme Z-Awakening by clearing levels. 
In general, the higher the level of the enemy you defeat, 
the better your chances of obtaining rare Awakening Medals. 

The rewards obtainable upon victory can be 
checked by tapping the "Battle Info" button.

You can also view some of the available rewards 
when selecting a level.

HP, ATK, and DEF in a {color : #FFFF00}well-balanced manner{color}. 
With routes extending to the lower right, 
you can only activate nodes when a character's Super Attack  
has reached a certain level, but {color : #FFFF00}higher growth can be expected{color}. 

{color : #FF0000}*The size and quantity of Potential Orbs required as well as 
the stats to be boosted differ by node.{color}
Activating this node with Potential Orbs raises a character's ATK.

With routes extending to the upper right, 
{color : #FFFF00}ATK-focused growth{color} can be expected. 

{color : #FF0000}*The size and quantity of Potential Orbs required as well as 
the stats to be boosted differ by node.{color}
Activating this node with Potential Orbs raises a character's DEF.

With routes extending to the lower left, 
{color : #FFFF00}HP and DEF-focused growth{color} can be expected. 

{color : #FF0000}*The size and quantity of Potential Orbs required as well as 
the stats to be boosted differ by node.{color}

There are seven kinds of Hidden Potential Skills in total. 
The higher the sum of the level activated, 
the higher the chances of the skills being activated and 
the greater the effect of the skills.

For more information on Hidden Potential Skills, 
tap the Skill icons on the upper part of the screen.

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}= About the Portal of Memories ={outline}{color}{size}
This feature grants access to past events.

* You must have the corresponding Keys 
to challenge an event. 
* The Keys are consumable items. 
* The stages' content and rewards will be the same 
as the ones from the events held in the past. 
* Treasure Items obtained from the Portal of Memories 
can be used only when the corresponding section is 
available at Baba's Shop. 
* Selectable stages will be added in the future. 
* Stage Clear Details from "Event" will be 
carried over to the Portal of Memories. 
{color : #FFFF00}[Info that will be carried over 
between Event and Portal of Memories]{color} 
- Stage Clear Details 
- Team from Previous Clear 
- Clear Record 
- Level Reached in Extreme Z-Battle 

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}- Reopening Events{outline}{color}{size} 
On the "Event" page, a notice will be shown in 
the bottom-right corner shortly before the 
reopening events are available. 
The text will change to "Event Coming Soon" 
one day before the events reopen.

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}- In Preparation{outline}{color}{size}
When the event is in preparation,
you will not be able to challenge the event
and its button will be grayed out.

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}- Limited{outline}{color}{size}
In the Portal of Memories, there are special
events that require a "Limited Key" to challenge.
"Limited" contents will be updated in the future.

Keys can be obtained via various ways 
such as Login Bonus and missions.

{color: #FFFF00}Step 4: Confirm Trial Mission Result!{color} 
Completed Trial Missions will be marked with 
a "Success" stamp. You will get the reward(s) 
upon completing a Trial Mission.

The special Treasures obtained from the Trial Missions 
can be exchanged for goods at Baba's Shop. 

* More Trial Missions to be added in the future.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}- Activating Active Skills{outline}{color}{size} 
Tap the icon of a character whose Active Skill is 
ready to be activated and swipe up. Let go when "Release!" 
appears to activate the skill.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Are Active Skills? ={outline}{color}{size} 
These are special skills that belong only to certain characters. 
They can be activated in battle at any time once 
certain conditions are met. 
The conditions required to activate Active Skills differ 
from skill to skill, as do their effects. 

You can check the activation conditions and the skill's effects 
from "Active Skill" found on the "Character Details" page. 
In general, Active Skills can be used once per battle.

The "Active Skill" option will not appear for 
characters who do not possess an Active Skill.

{size: 25}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Is Transformation? ={outline}{color}{size} 
This is a Passive Skill that belongs to certain characters. 
It can only be activated in battle during the character's 
attacking turn when certain conditions are met. 
The conditions required to activate Transformation differ from 
skill to skill. Transformation can only be used once per battle. 
* Some characters can deactivate then reactivate 
their Transformation in the same battle. 
The Transformation will be deactivated automatically 
when a battle ends. 

You can check the activation conditions and 
the character's stats after Transformation by tapping 
the "Transformation Button" ("Fusion Button" in the image) 
found at the top of the "Character Details" page.

The "Transformation Button" will not appear for 
characters who do not possess a Transformation. 

{color: #FFFF00}- Performing Link Skills After Transformation{color} 
Characters who can Transform (Fusion, Special Fusion etc.) 
can still activate their Link Skills when placed next to 
characters with the same name, but different second name, 
after Transformation.

* Turns that pass during special conditions, such as 
Giant Ape mode, will not be counted toward the 
required turns necessary for Transformation. 
 
{size: 25}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}- When a Leader Skill is no longer 
applicable after Transformation{outline}{color}{size} 
Leader Skills may no longer apply to a character 
after the character transforms. While HP will not 
be affected, the character's ATK and DEF will change. 
Likewise, when a character transforms and a Leader Skill 
becomes applicable to the character, the character's HP 
will not change, but ATK and DEF will.

Reward Boost is {color : #FFFF00}a feature that increases the number of 
rewards obtainable from a stage{color}. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Reward Boost Effect ={outline}{color}{size} 

This feature increases the number of rewards obtainable 
from a stage. 

{color : #FFFF00}Rewards that can be increased:{color} 
- Rewards obtainable from the map. 
- Rewards obtainable upon victory. 
- Rewards obtainable upon clearing a stage. 

{color : #FFFF00}Rewards that cannot be increased:{color} 
- First clear rewards (e.g. Dragon Stones). 
- First-drop rewards, including characters 
   (certain stages excluded).

* This feature will not be applicable for certain rewards, 
such as those obtained from "Baba" tiles and 
"Dragon Ball" tiles.
* Bonus rewards from the special effect of Categories are 
considered rewards obtained upon victory, thus can also 
be increased through Reward Boost.
* For rewards obtained upon victory, those obtained 
through Reward Boost will be randomly selected.
As a result, you may not receive multiple rewards of 
the same kind.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= How to Use Reward Boost ={outline}{color}{size}

Reward Boost can only be used in stages that have already 
been cleared.
You can turn on this feature by tapping the button 
located on the difficulty selection screen.

When using Reward Boost, the STA required 
for challenging a stage will increase.

* Reward Boost cannot be used in a difficulty that hasn't 
been cleared.
* Reward Boost cannot be used on certain stages, 
even if they have been cleared.
* Your maximum STA must exceed the STA 
to be consumed when using the Reward Boost feature.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Limited Uses = {outline}{color}{size}

This feature has a limitation on the number of uses.
You will temporarily be unable to use this feature 
when the number of uses becomes 0.
The number of uses will restore by 1 after 
a certain period of time.

Skill Orbs are items that boost a character's stats 
or raise a character's Hidden Potential Skill level 
when equipped to corresponding slots. 

They come in the following three rarities: 
Bronze, Silver and Gold.

When a Skill Orb has multiple effects, the level 
displayed on its item icon will be the level of 
the effect with the {color : #FFFF00}highest value{color}. 

Only {color : #FFFF00}UR or LR{color} characters can equip Skill Orbs.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= How to Acquire Skill Orbs ={outline}{color}{size} 
You can obtain Skill Orbs in different ways, 
such as from events and missions. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= About Reverse/ 
Reverse Dokkan Awakening ={outline}{color}{size} 
The {color : #FFFF00}effects obtained from equipped Skill Orbs 
will be carried over{color} even after performing 
a Reverse/Reverse Dokkan Awakening.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Conditions for Equipping Skill Orbs ={outline}{color}{size} 
Skill Orbs have a slot rarity of Bronze, Silver or Gold. 
Each slot must be unlocked for each character 
according to its conditions. 

Slots for which you have yet to fulfill the necessary 
conditions will be displayed as {color : #FFFF00}locked{color}.

Conditions for unlocking each rarity: 

1. Skill Orb (Gold Slot) 
Unlock {color : #FFFF00}two of the character's Hidden Potential routes{color}.

2. Skill Orb (Silver Slot) 
Raise the character's {color : #FFFF00}Super Attack to Lv. 10{color}.

3. Skill Orb (Bronze Slot) 
Awaken the character to {color : #FFFF00}UR{color}.

Equip Skill Orbs by tapping on slots on 
the Hidden Potential screen. Slots for which 
the necessary conditions have not been fulfilled 
will be displayed as locked. Only Skill Orbs that can 
be equipped to the selected slot will be displayed.

{color : #FF0000}* You cannot remove a Skill Orb once you equip it to a character.{color} 

To equip a new Skill Orb, simply {color : #FFFF00}equip it over the old one{color}.

Except for {color : #FFFF00}certain special ones{color}, Skill Orbs {color : #FFFF00}will not be 
returned{color} if you replace them. Please consider carefully 
before swapping them for new ones.

{color : #FFFF00}Special Stickers{color} are items that allow you to apply
exclusive visual effects to characters.

You can get Special Stickers in different ways, such as 
in Chain Battle or from Ultimate Clash Missions. 

{color : #FF0000}* You may not remove Special Stickers once 
you have applied them.{color}

Selecting the "Dark" mode allows you to reduce 
the strain on your eyes while playing at night or 
in a dark environment, or lessen discomfort due to 
any flashing or excessive brightness.

You can select "Dark" by going to Home Screen --> 
Menu --> Options --> Animation Brightness to change 
the animation brightness.

{color : #FF0000}Note: 
If you start to experience strain on your eyes or body, 
you should stop your play session, regardless of the 
brightness setting.{color}

Secret Treasure Chests can be obtained in 
exchange for specified {color : #FFFF00}Treasure Items{color}. 
Random items can be obtained from 
Secret Treasure Chests.

* Tap and hold the Secret Treasure Chest icon
to check the "List of Available Items" for 
more information on the contents. 

* Some items can only be exchanged for 
a limited period of time.

* New types of Treasure Items will continue 
to be added.

In addition, you can check the enemy's skills and status
by tapping and holding the enemy's character icon.

The "Enemy Skill" section displays the enemy's skills
and the "Enemy Status" section displays the change
in the enemy's status during battle.

{color: #FFFF00}= About Link Skill Level ={color} 
Link Skills can be leveled up with 
Link Skill Orbs or through battles. 
 
1. Leveling up Link Skills with Link Skill Orbs. 
Link Skill levels can be raised by using 
the exclusive item "Link Skill Orb". 
The type and number of Link Skill Orbs 
required to level up a Link Skill vary 
depending on the Link Skill's level. 
 
To level up Link Skills using Link Skill Orbs, 
navigate the path "Growth -> Link Skill" 
and select a character whose Link Skills 
you would like to level up. 
 
2. Leveling up Link Skills through battles. 
Each time, the Link Skill(s) will be randomly selected 
to level up on the "Battle Results" screen. 
There is a chance for the Link Skill(s) to level up by 1.

* Link Skill levels will not be raised in Extreme Z-Battle,
Virtual Dokkan Ultimate Clash, Explosive Chain Battle
and the World Tournament.
There are also certain stages where Link Skill levels
will not be raised.

= How Certain Link Skills Work
After the Implementation of the New Feature =

- Link Skills That Raise ATK or DEF
When a Link Skill that raises ATK or DEF is activated, its
effect will be determined by the character's Link Skill level.

<Example 1>
Super Saiyan God SS Vegeta's Link Skill "Prodigies" is Lv. 1
and Piccolo's Link Skill "Prodigies" is Lv. 2.
Thus, Super Saiyan God SS Vegeta will receive the effect of
Lv. 1 and Piccolo will receive the effect of Lv. 2.

<Example 2>
When the second attacker possesses Link Skills that can
be linked with the first and third attacker, and the skills
have different names, then both Link Skills will be activated.

Piccolo, the second attacker, can activate the Link Skill
"Prodigies" with the first attacker Super Saiyan God
SS Vegeta and can activate the Link Skill "Z Fighters"
with the third attacker Krillin.
Since "Prodigies" and "Z Fighters" are two different
Link Skills, Piccolo can receive the effect of both Link Skills.

- Link Skills That Raise Ki
When a Link Skill that raises Ki is activated, its effect
will be determined by the character's Link Skill level.

<Example 1>
Goku (Kaioken)'s Link Skill "Over in a Flash" is Lv. 2 and
Frieza (Full Power)'s Link Skill "Over in a Flash" is Lv. 1.
Thus, Goku (Kaioken) will receive the effect of Lv. 2 and
Frieza (Full Power) will receive the effect of Lv. 1.

<Example 2>
When the second attacker possesses Link Skills that can
be linked with the first and third attacker, and the skills
have different names, then both Link Skills will be activated.

Frieza (Full Power), the second attacker, can activate
the Link Skill "Over in a Flash" with the first attacker
Goku (Kaioken) and can activate the Link Skill "Strongest
Clan in Space" with the third attacker Metal Cooler.
Since "Over in a Flash" and "Strongest Clan in Space" are
two different Link Skills, Frieza (Full Power) can receive
the effect of both Link Skills.

- Link Skills That Reduce the Enemy's DEF
When a Link Skill that reduces the enemy's DEF is activated,
the effect of neighboring characters will not be combined.
Only the Link Skill of the character whose Link Skill level is
higher will be activated.
If the Link Skill is activated 2 times, as described in example 2,
the effect of both activations will be combined and applied
to the enemy.

<Example 1>
The Link Skill "Telekinesis" will be activated between
Chiaotzu and General Blue.
Since "Telekinesis" is a Link Skill that reduces enemy DEF,
only the effect of Chiaotzu, whose Link Skill level is higher,
will be activated.

<Example 2>
The Link Skill "Telekinesis" will be activated between
Chiaotzu (first attacker) and General Blue (second attacker).
It will also be activated between General Blue (second attacker) 
and Supreme Kai (third attacker).

In this situation, the first activation will be determined by 
Chiaotzu's Link Skill level, and the effect of "Telekinesis Lv. 5" 
will be activated. The second activation will be determined by 
Supreme Kai's Link Skill level, and the effect of 
"Telekinesis Lv. 5" will be activated.

- Link Skills That Recover HP
When a Link Skill that recovers HP is activated, the effect
of neighboring characters will not be combined. Only the
Link Skill of the character whose Link Skill level is higher
will be activated.

<Example 1>
The Link Skill "Namekians" will be activated between
Piccolo and Lord Slug.
Since "Namekians" is a Link Skill that recovers HP, only
the effect of Piccolo, whose Link Skill level is higher, will
be activated.

<Example 2>
The Link Skill "Namekians" will be activated between
Piccolo (first attacker) and Lord Slug (second attacker).
It will also be activated between Lord Slug (second attacker)
and Nail (third attacker).

In this situation, the first activation will be determined by
Piccolo's Link Skill level, and the effect of "Namekians Lv. 6"
will be activated. The second activation will be determined by
Nail's Link Skill level, and the effect of "Namekians Lv. 5" will
be activated.

- Link Skills Activated When Performing Super Attacks
When neighboring characters possess a Link Skill of
the same name, only the character who is about to 
perform a Super Attack will have the Link Skill activated.

<Example 1>
The Link Skill "Kamehameha" will be activated between
Goku and Master Roshi.
Since Goku is about to perform a Super Attack, the effect
of "Kamehameha" will be applied to Goku.

<Example 2>
The Link Skill "Kamehameha" will be activated between
Goku and Master Roshi.
Since both Goku and Master Roshi are about to perform
a Super Attack, the effect of "Kamehameha" will be
applied to both of them.
