{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Are Conditional Super Attacks? ={outline}{color}{size} 
These are special Super Attacks only certain characters have. 
They will be activated in battle when certain conditions are met. 
The activation of a Conditional Super Attack that has a more 
powerful effect will be prioritized. If the effects are the same, 
the Conditional Super Attack triggered by the ally furthest 
to the left will be prioritized.

When the activation conditions are met, an animation with 
a scene similar to the one shown below will be played. 
Please note that a character can only launch a 
Conditional Super Attack once per turn.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Activation Conditions ={outline}{color}{size} 
The activation conditions of Conditional Super Attacks 
differ between Super Attacks. You can check the activation 
conditions on each character's "Character Details" page.

Support Memories are items that can be used 
in Quests and Events.

{size : 24}{color : #FF9900}= How to Use ={size}{color} 
Support Memories are used by bringing them to 
Quests and Events. 

In order to use Support Memories, you must complete 
them first by collecting a certain number of them.

Try to collect the required quantity through different 
ways, such as in events where they are available.

{size : 24}{color : #FF9900}= Activation and Effects ={size}{color} 
The Support Memory you bring with you will be 
automatically activated when certain conditions 
are met, thereby triggering its effect. 

The activation conditions and effects differ 
between Support Memories. They can be 
viewed on the "Item Details" screen. 

Activating a Support Memory requires 
"Film" of the corresponding color.

Corresponding Film will be consumed 
when the Support Memory is activated. 

The number and type of Film required differ 
between Support Memories. In addition, 
Film is consumed only once per challenge. 

Note that any Support Memory you bring 
with you will only be activated and take effect 
if you have enough of the right type of Film.

{size : 24}{color : #FF9900}= Film ={size}{color} 
There are five types of Film. 

You can obtain them through different ways, such as 
clearing stages from Quests and Events or exchanging 
Trade Points for them at Baba's Shop.

There is a limit on the number of each Film type you can keep. 
If you reach the limit and then obtain Film as, for example, 
a reward for clearing a stage, it will be automatically discarded. 
To avoid this, consuming any Film you have by using 
Support Memories is recommended. 

{size : 24}{color : #FF9900}= Auto ON ={size}{color}
Enabling "Auto ON" on the "Select Support Memory" 
screen will randomly select a Support Memory to 
bring from among those that you currently own. 

During random selection, Support Memories you 
have a sufficient quantity of Film to activate will 
be prioritized. 

{size : 24}{color : #FF9900}= Support Memory Boost ={size}{color}
Boosting a Support Memory powers up its effects. 
A Support Memory will be automatically boosted 
after all the Memory Medals required for a boost 
are collected.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Is the Revival Skill? ={outline}{color}{size} 
This is a special skill that belongs only to certain characters. 
After certain conditions are met in battle, it will activate 
and revive all characters on your team by restoring HP 
once only when HP has fallen to 0.

The Revival Skill can be activated even in stages where 
"Continues" are not allowed, with some exceptions. 

Although it can only be activated once per battle, 
returning to the map will reset the revival count, 
allowing you to activate the Revival Skill again 
in your next battle. Note that even if more than 
one character on your team has a Revival Skill, 
only one of the characters' Revival Skills can 
be activated in a single battle. 

Revived characters will retain effects that were 
applied to them before they were revived, such as 
ATK or DEF boosting/reducing effects. 

If your HP once again falls to 0 after revival, 
the "Continue" pop-up message will appear. 
On stages that do not allow "Continues", 
it will be Game Over.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= About Revival Icons ={outline}{color}{size} 
[When a character who has a Revival Skill is on the team]
[When revival is possible]
[After the Revival Skill has been activated]

Characters that undergo visual changes will retain effects 
that were applied to them before the change, such as 
ATK or DEF boosting/reducing effects.

You can check the "Character Details" page to see which 
characters are capable of undergoing visual changes.
Super Attacks are divided into a variety of types.

Each Super Attack belongs to a corresponding 
Super Attack type. 

You can sort characters by Super Attack types using the filter. 
Tap the icon of a Super Attack type, and characters whose 
Super Attacks belong to the selected type will be displayed.

If a character's Super Attack changes due to Transformation 
or Absorption, the character will be filtered based on 
the Super Attack type before Transformation. 

If a character's Super Attack changes due to chance or 
the Ki collected, the character will be filtered based on 
all the Super Attacks' types. 

If a character has an Active Skill that can be activated as 
a Super Attack, the character will also be filtered based on 
the Super Attack type which the Active Skill belongs to. 
When a character has an Active Skill and a Super Attack 
that belong to different Super Attack types, the 
character will be categorized into both groups.
{color : #FFFF00}Ki Boost {color}

Characters with this icon can charge up more 
Ki than normal when collecting Ki Spheres.

*This does not apply to certain types of Ki Spheres.

Clearing maps will allow you to use auto mode for 
maps and battles (this does not apply to Quests 
and Extreme Z-Battles). 
{color : #FFFF00}* Auto mode cannot be used on certain maps.{color}

Simply tap to turn auto mode on or off. 
 
During auto mode, the amount of STA consumed, 
the number of dropped items obtained and the 
character stats will not be different from that 
of the usual mode. In addition, you can use 
Reward Boost during auto mode. 
 
When moving in auto mode, the largest of the three 
numbers displayed will be selected. If there is a split 
in the path, one will be picked at random. 
 
Auto mode can be toggled on or off on certain 
screens while moving on the map and during battle. 
In "Quest", you can also turn auto mode on or off 
on the difficulty-selection screen. 
 
{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}Dokkan Mode in Auto Mode{outline}{color}{size} 
Dokkan Mode can be controlled manually even 
when in auto mode.

You can view the following information in "My Profile". 
{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Main Page ={outline}{color}{size} 
- Nickname 
- Player Rank 
- Friends List 
- Title 
- Pixel Character 
- Power Level 
- Friend Supporter 
- Favorite Character 
 
To go to the subpage, tap the "Subpage" button 
on the main page.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Power Level ={outline}{color}{size} 
Power level is represented by a number calculated 
based on the following values: 
- Number of Hidden Potential nodes activated: 
   1 node = 1 pt. 
- Number of Link Skills at max level: 
   1 skill = 1000 pts. 
- Number of stages cleared (by difficulty): 
   1 difficulty = 50 pts. 
- Number of Dokkan Awakened characters: 
   1 character = 150 pts. 
 
{color : #FFFF00}* Reversing a character will not cause your power level 
to decrease, and Reverse Dokkan Awakening will not 
cause it to increase. 
* Power level will decrease when a character is consumed.{color}

Your power level is the sum total of points 
accumulated across each category. 
 
{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Subpage ={outline}{color}{size} 
- Number of battles participated in by each character 
- Number of stages cleared for each event type 

Setting "Share Subpage" to "OFF" prevents 
other players from viewing it when they visit. 
 
{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Pixel Characters ={outline}{color}{size} 
Pixel Characters develop over a set period 
based on the following three factors: 
- Number of days logged in 
- Amount of STA consumed 
- Number of Daily Missions completed 
{color : #FFFF00}* A Daily Mission will be counted 
after the mission reward is claimed.{color}

Pixel Characters will return to their initial state 
after a set period of time has elapsed. 
 
{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Titles ={outline}{color}{size} 
Titles are acquired by fulfilling the requirements 
stipulated for each one.
You can view the requirements in the lists of Titles.

Your Favorite Character will be the character 
you set on the main page of "My Profile". 
 
You can change your Favorite Character 
by tapping the slot.

{color : #FFFF00}* Setting a character as your favorite will not boost 
the character's stats or grant any special effects. 
* This character will be visible to any player 
who visits your "My Profile" page.{color}

You acquire Titles by fulfilling various conditions 
in Dokkan Battle. 
 
Titles you have not yet obtained are grayed out. However, 
you can check the requirements for acquiring them.

To change the Title displayed on the main page, 
tap on any Title you have acquired.

The Title you set will be displayed in the Friends List and 
on the main page, and will be visible to other players.

Tapping a Title you have not yet acquired will 
display the requirements for obtaining it. If it 
can be acquired from an event, tapping the 
"Attempt" button will take you directly to that event.

Power level is represented by a number calculated 
based on the following values: 
- Number of Hidden Potential nodes activated: 
   1 node = 1 pt. 
- Number of Link Skills at max level: 
   1 skill = 1000 pts. 
- Number of stages cleared (by difficulty): 
   1 difficulty = 50 pts. 
- Number of Dokkan Awakened characters: 
   1 character = 150 pts. 
 
{color : #FFFF00}* Reversing a character will not cause your power level 
to decrease, and Reverse Dokkan Awakening will not 
cause it to increase. 
* Power level will decrease when a character is consumed.{color}

Your power level is the sum total of points 
accumulated across each category.

Pixel Characters develop over a set period 
based on the following three factors: 
- Number of days logged in 
- Amount of STA consumed 
- Number of Daily Missions completed 
{color : #FFFF00}* A Daily Mission will be counted 
after the mission reward is claimed.{color}

Pixel Characters will return to their initial state 
after a set period of time has elapsed. 
 
Plus, you can obtain rewards based on the level 
that the Pixel Character has been raised to 
during the specified period. 
 
The rewards can be claimed after the growth period ends.

You can perform the following actions from the Friends List: 
- Visit a player's "User Profile" page. 
- View the Title a player has set.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Count Display ={outline}{color}{size} 
On a player's subpage, you can view the 
most recent value for the following: 
- Number of battles participated in by each character 
- Number of stages cleared for each event type 
 
Tap the button at the top of the screen to toggle 
between the information displayed.

Setting "Share Subpage" to "OFF" prevents 
other players from viewing it when they visit.
{color : #FFFF00}Immunity to Super Attack Seal{color}

The Super Attacks of characters 
with this icon cannot be sealed.
{color : #FFFF00}Revival Skill Icon{color}

Characters with this icon have met the 
Revival Skill activation condition(s) and 
entered a state where Revival is possible.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Other Notes ={color}{outline}{size} 
Hidden Potential will not be passed on even if 
the characters you used as Training Partners 
have it activated.

When you tap the "Attempt Again" button on 
the stage clear screen to attempt a stage you 
have just cleared again, you will return directly 
to the screen shown before you start the stage.

Burst Mode is a mode where you can play ongoing 
Dokkan Events and Story Events under the Burst Mode 
conditions you have selected. It is available during 
the specified event period, and you have to meet 
certain requirements to attempt it.

The teams you used to clear Burst Mode will not 
be displayed in "Records". 

You must clear the stage on all difficulties to attempt 
Burst Mode. {color : #FFFF00}Even if you have not met the requirements, 
you can still attempt Burst Mode after you meet 
the requirements during the event period.{color}

You cannot use Continues when attempting Burst Mode.

The event period of Burst Mode can be checked on 
each event's page or through the "Burst Mode" button 
located on the home screen.

In Burst Mode, the special effects of characters 
who have an advantage when attempting the stage 
are rendered ineffective. 
{color : #FFFF00}* This includes special effects that increase drop rates.{color}

In Burst Mode, you can attempt stages under 
the Burst Mode conditions of your choice.

Your temporary score will be recorded and will be 
converted into Burst Coins during the claim period.

Various Burst Mode conditions, such as {color : #FFFF00}restrictions to 
the challenging team and stronger enemies{color}, are available 
for selection in Burst Mode. 

In Burst Mode, the special effects of characters 
who have an advantage when attempting the stage 
are rendered ineffective. 
{color : #FFFF00}* This includes special effects that increase drop rates.{color}

{color : #FFFF00}Multiple Burst Mode conditions can be 
selected at a time.{color}

The available Burst Mode conditions vary between events. 
Before the event period of Burst Mode ends, the Burst 
Mode conditions you last selected will be automatically 
saved regardless of whether you have attempted the 
stage under Burst Mode.

You will get a temporary score by clearing a stage 
under one or more Burst Mode conditions. 

During the claim period, your temporary score will be
calculated and converted into Burst Coins.

You will temporarily get the estimated score upon clearing 
Burst Mode. After the Burst Mode event period ends, 
the score you temporarily get will be converted into 
Burst Coins, which can be exchanged for items.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Score Update ={outline}{color}{size}
In Burst Mode, your score will not accumulate. 
Your highest score will be updated when you clear 
Burst Mode under conditions that will earn you 
a score higher than your current temporary score.

{color : #FFFF00}In addition, when the event reopens, points that have already 
been converted into coins cannot be obtained again.{color}

The "Music Collection" is a place where tracks acquired 
here can be played. You can also set the acquired tracks 
to certain places.

To play a track, tap an album cover to access 
the tracklist and then tap on the "Play" button.

More tracks will be added to the "Music Collection" 
in the future. Please stay tuned.

To set a track to "My Profile" or a team, you must 
acquire the track first. In addition, you have to fulfill 
a track's unlocking conditions to acquire it. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Checking Unlocking Conditions ={outline}{color}{size}
A track will be shown with a lock icon if 
you have not met its unlocking conditions. 
You can check the conditions by tapping the slot.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Exchange Using Burst Coins ={outline}{color}{size} 
Tap the "Trade" button to exchange for a track 
that you have not acquired by spending Burst Coins. 
Burst Coins can be obtained in Burst Mode.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Setting a Track ={outline}{color}{size}
The tracks you have acquired can be 
set to the following places: 
- My Profile 
The track set to "My Profile" will also be played 
when other players visit the page.

- Teams 
The track set to a team will be played in battle 
when you attempt a stage you have cleared before. 

{color : #FFFF00}* The track set to a team will be played in the 
World Tournament and Extreme Z-Battles even if 
you have not cleared the event before.{color}

{color : #FFFF00}* The track set to a team may not be played in 
some situations, such as when you attempt 
certain special stages.{color}

The frame of the track you have set will change and 
the settings button will turn orange.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Removing a Track You Have Set ={outline}{color}{size}
To remove a track, tap the settings button again.

After you remove a track, the settings will return 
to default settings.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Standby Skills ={outline}{color}{size} 
These are special skills that belong only to certain characters.

Once the activation conditions are met, Standby Skills 
can be activated at any time by swiping the character 
icon downwards. The conditions required to activate 
Standby Skills differ from skill to skill, as do their effects. 
In general, Standby Skills can be used once per battle. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Standby Mode ={outline}{color}{size} 
Activating a Standby Skill causes it to enter {color: #FFFF00}Standby Mode{color}. 
A {color: #FFFF00}Finish Effect{color} can be activated when certain conditions 
are met while in Standby Mode.

On the "Support Memory Details" page, you can tap 
the buttons to compare a Support Memory's effects 
before and after a boost.

Memory Medals are items required to boost Support Memories. 
The types and number of Memory Medals required differ 
between Support Memories.

Memory Medals can be obtained in various ways, 
such as certain events, login bonuses and missions.
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Flying Nimbus" Tile{color}

If you stop on this tile, your team will hop on the 
Flying Nimbus and fly to another tile on the map.

Special Friends are supporters you can 
choose instead of a Friend's character 
on the "Select Friend" page.

Special Friends can be selected in certain events. 
There are also events where your Friends' 
characters cannot be selected, and you can 
only select a {color: #FFFF00}Special Friend{color} as a supporter.

You can check a Standby Skill's activation conditions and 
effects on the "Character Details" page or by tapping 
the UI displayed during battles. 

{color : #FFFF00}- Exiting Standby Mode{color} 
Standby Mode will end after the Finish Effect is activated 
or after the given number of turns for Standby Mode 
have passed. With some exceptions, a character will 
return to its form before the activation of the Standby Skill 
when Standby Mode is over. 
* Turns in Standby Mode will not elapse while in Giant Form. 
* Standby Skills of the same type cannot be activated 
repeatedly. 

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Standby Mode Types ={outline}{color}{size} 
A special UI exclusive to that type of Standby Mode 
will appear on the battle screen during Standby Mode. 

{color : #FFFF00}- Charge{color}

During Standby Mode, the charge count will increase if the 
charge conditions are met. The conditions and the amount 
charged differ from skill to skill. Actions by all characters 
participating in battle contribute to the count. 

A Finish Effect can be activated at any time except the turn 
in which Standby Mode was entered. Once the count 
reaches the maximum, "full charge" state is reached, 
and the Finish Effect changes. The count can still increase 
after it reaches the maximum, and additional change 
may occur to the effect of the Finish Effect when the 
count exceeds the maximum. 

* When in Giant Form, the number of Ki Spheres obtained 
will not be added to the count. 

{color : #FFFF00}Revival Counterattack{color}

A Revival Counterattack will be automatically activated 
when KO'd in Standby Mode. The enemy who 
delivered the K.O. attack will be targeted. 

Standby Skills with a Revival Counterattack cannot be 
activated if a Revival Skill is already activated. When 
another character's Revival Skill is activated during 
Standby Mode, the Revival Counterattack can no longer 
be launched and Standby Mode will end.

{color : #FFFF00}- Finish Effect (Counterattack){color}

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Is a Domain? ={outline}{color}{size} 
A Domain can apply effects to all characters in battle, 
enemies and allies alike. Every Domain has its own 
creation conditions, and a Domain will be created 
in battle once its conditions are met. 

The creation conditions differ based on each 
character's skills. The background will change 
once a Domain is created.

Burst Coins can be exchanged for {color : #FFFF00}tracks{color} in the 
"Music Collection" located in "My Profile".

The skills of the enemy that appears in the stage and the 
restrictions of the stage will be carried over to Burst Mode.

A Domain and its effects only last for a given number of 
turns, after which the background returns to normal and 
the effects end. 

You can check the effects of a Domain by tapping 
the Domain icon found on the battle screen or 
on the "Character Details" page.

If there is already a Domain created in battle, 
it cannot be replaced by a new Domain even if 
the new Domain's creation conditions are met.

Domains will remain effective in the following situations: 
- When entering the next phase 
- When revived 
- After using a Continue 

* When a character performs Giant Form Transformation, 
the count for the number of turns that have elapsed in 
a Domain will be paused, and Giant Form state will be 
entered. During Giant Form state, the effects of 
a Domain will not take effect. The Domain will return 
after the Giant Form state ends. 

If the creation conditions of multiple Domains are met 
at the same time, the Domain of the character 
furthest to the left will be created.

Link Skill Orbs are items used to raise 
a character's Link Skill level.

The type and number of Link Skill Orbs 
required to level up a Link Skill vary 
depending on the Link Skill's level. 
 
Link Skill Orbs can be obtained through 
various ways, such as events and missions.

The rewards are distributed after the growth period ends, 
and can be claimed until the growth period of the next 
Pixel Character ends. You will automatically receive 
the rewards after you proceed to the home screen 
upon logging in during the claim period. 
 
The available rewards can be checked by tapping the 
button on the Pixel Character located in "My Profile".
{color: #FFFF00}▼"Goal" Tile{color}
The stage is cleared when you arrive at this tile.

You can check the power level bonuses that are activated 
from the list of power level bonuses.

By tapping certain power level bonuses, you can check 
the list of power level bonuses of the same type.
- Potential Orbs
- Training Items
- Support Items
- Treasure Items

The drop rates of the specified items will be increased. 

- Characters

The drop rates of characters will be increased by the 
value specified in the power level bonus description. 

{color : #FFFF00}* Bonus drop rates for items and characters 
increased via power level bonuses are different 
from the bonus drop rates set in stages.{color}

{color : #FFFF00}- Bonuses that increase the amount of Zeni obtained{color} 
After reaching the "Goal" tile, the amount of 
Zeni obtained will be increased by the value 
specified in the power level bonus description, 
and the sum will be displayed on the result screen. 
Please note that this type of power level bonus 
does not apply to Zeni obtained as mission rewards 
or by selling characters.

{color : #FFFF00}- Bonuses that increase the number of attempts available{color} 
The number of times you can attempt the event specified 
in the power level bonus description will be increased. 
When an event's number of attempts available is increased, 
the increased number of attempts will be displayed in the 
colors of the rainbow.

Power level bonuses of the same type will not be 
activated at the same time. Only the power level 
bonus of the highest value will be activated. 

For example: 
- Required power level: 50,000 
   Drop rates of Training Items increase by 10% 
- Required power level: 100,000 
   Drop rates of Awakening Medals increase by 10% 
- Required power level: 200,000 
   Drop rates of Awakening Medals increase by 20% 
In this case, the power level bonuses "drop rates of 
Training Items increase by 10%" and "drop rates of 
Awakening Medals increase by 20%" will be activated. 

For power level bonuses that increase the number of 
attempts available, multiple power level bonuses can be 
activated at the same time but limited to one for each event.

Finish Effects (Counterattack) will automatically 
activate when being attacked in Standby Mode. 
If a Finish Effect (Counterattack) is already activated, 
it will not activate again if you receive another attack 
in the same turn.

【수련 성공】 
수련 시 발생하는 "대성공", "특대성공", 
"초특대성공"에 대한 EXP의 배율 및 발생 확률 정보.

【서포트 아이템】 
일부 서포트 아이템의 효과에 기재된 "랜덤"의 확률 정보.
{color : #FFFF00}Interruption{color}

When in this state, a character's next move will be disabled. 
This effect only applies to the turn in which it is activated.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= What Are Territory Skills? ={outline}{color}{size} 
Territory Skills can activate effects that give an 
advantage to enemies or effects that are relatively 
detrimental to your characters in battle. 
 
The skill effects differ between Territory Skills. 
The icons of the effects activated by Territory Skills 
are framed by dashed lines.

An icon for Territory Skills will be displayed when 
a Territory Skill is activated, and you can check 
the Territory Skill's effects and end conditions by 
tapping the icon.

Territory Skills have end conditions. When a Domain 
is created, the activation of a Territory Skill will end. 
Once the activation of the Domain is over, the 
Territory Skill will be activated again. 
 
* If a character enters Giant Form state while the 
Domain is active, the Territory Skill will be activated 
since the effects of a Domain do not take effect 
during Giant Form state. After the Giant Form state 
ends, the Domain will return and the activation of 
the Territory Skill will end.

Certain characters can be Super Extreme Z-Awakened 
after Extreme Z-Awakening.

After Super Extreme Z-Awakening, 
a character's Passive Skill will change. 
In addition, an exclusive effect will be applied 
to the character's icon on the "Character List".

The Awakening Medals required for Super 
Extreme Z-Awakening differ between characters. 
You can get the required Awakening Medals in 
Lv. SUPER of the corresponding Extreme Z-Battle. 
 
Check the Awakening screen after 
Super Extreme Z-Awakening to see 
how much a character has powered up! 
 
* Characters must undergo the final step 
of Extreme Z-Awakening before they can 
be Super Extreme Z-Awakened.

In certain Extreme Z-Battles, Lv. SUPER will become 
available for attempt after you clear a certain level. 
 
Once it becomes available, you can tap the 
"Lv. SUPER" button to access the Lv. SUPER screen.

Different from the usual levels in Extreme Z-Battle, 
the enemy will not level up after you clear Lv. SUPER. 
In addition, STA will still be consumed even if 
Lv. SUPER was not cleared. 
 
After clearing Lv. SUPER, you can get the Awakening 
Medals required for Super Extreme Z-Awakening.

On certain screens in "Quest", you can check the 
drop rewards from boss battles. 
 
- Stage-selection screen

When selecting a stage, {color : #FFFF00}you can check the items 
that can be obtained or the characters that can 
be recruited by defeating the stage boss{color}. 

- Difficulty-selection screen 
You can check the items that can be obtained or 
the characters that can be recruited by defeating 
the boss of each difficulty.

By tapping the details button, a pop-up that 
allows you to check the lists of {color : #FFFF00}guaranteed drop 
rewards{color} and {color : #FFFF00}possible drop rewards{color} will appear.

Details of an item or character can be confirmed 
by tapping and holding the corresponding icon.
{color : #FFFF00}Disable Interruption{color}

Characters with this icon 
are not subject to Interruption.
{color : #FFFF00}Attack Attraction{color}

Enemy attacks will be directed towards the character 
with this icon. This skill does not apply to enemies' 
all-target attacks and all-target Super Attacks. 
When more than one character activates Attack Attraction, 
the one activated previously will be replaced and only 
the latest one will remain active.
{color : #FFFF00}Guaranteed Hit{color}

A state that can disable evasion skills. 
The attacks of characters with this icon 
are guaranteed to hit the enemy even if 
the enemy possesses an evasion skill.
{color : #FFFF00}Disable Guaranteed Hit{color}

A state that can disable guaranteed hits. 
Characters with this icon have a chance 
of evading the attacks from characters 
who can launch guaranteed hits.
{color : #FFFF00}Enemy Skill Icon{color}
{color : #FFFF00}Immune to Ki Blast Super Attack{color}

Characters with this icon can nullify 
Ki Blast Super Attacks.

Under the "Popular" tab on the "Clear Record" screen, 
you can check the Popular Teams that other players 
frequently used to clear the stage. Furthermore, 
you can copy and save them to your list of teams.

In addition, you can check the label on the 
character icon to check a character's 
recruitment or growth status. 
 
Check the formations of the Popular Teams 
if you are having trouble clearing a stage! 
 
{color : #FFFF00}* Please note that the "Popular" tab will not be 
displayed in certain events. 
* Please also note that this feature only allows you 
to copy the team formation. It is not a feature where 
you can borrow characters from other players or 
a feature that guarantees clearing a stage.{color}

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Special Ki Spheres ={outline}{color}{size} 
Special Ki Spheres, such as sweet treats and carrots, 
can be created by enemies' skills or Support Items. 
 
The effects activated by obtaining a special Ki Sphere 
differ between character skills or Support Item effects.

{size: 24}{outline: #FF0000, 2}{color: #FFFF00}= Damage Ki Spheres ={outline}{color}{size} 
{color: #FFFF00}Damage Ki Spheres{color} are special Ki Spheres with a bomb icon 
that are created by enemies' skills or Territory Skill effects. 
You will receive damage upon obtaining a Damage Ki Sphere, 
so make sure to check your remaining HP before collecting 
these Ki Spheres.

* Damage received from Damage Ki Spheres will not 
reduce HP to 0. 
* When obtaining a Damage Ki Sphere that is the same 
color as the character's Type, HP will also be recovered 
at the same time.

{size : 24}{color : #FFFF00}{outline : #FF0000, 2}2. Transfer Game Data via Transfer Code{outline}{color}{size} 
{color : #FFFF00}Transfer Code can no longer be created.{color}
Only Transfer Codes created in the past 
can be used to transfer data.
 
1. When launching the game for the first time, select 
"Continue Game" then "Transfer Game Data via Transfer
Code" and enter your "User ID" and "Transfer Code" to
transfer your data.

STA-Restoring Items can be used 
to restore your Stamina (STA). 
They can be obtained through various ways, 
such as login bonuses and missions. 
The item's effect varies according to its type.

The "Restore STA" window will pop up when you enter a stage 
without having enough STA. You can choose to restore your 
STA with a Dragon Stone or with STA-Restoring Items.

When using STA-Restoring Items, you can only select 
one type at a time. The system will automatically select 
a combination that allows you to restore the most STA, 
but you can change the type of item and the quantity 
to be used according to your needs.

When restoring STA with STA-Restoring Items, any 
restored STA exceeding your Maximum STA will be retained. 
However, you cannot restore STA with STA-Restoring Items 
when your current STA exceeds the maximum value.
